FuncDef: The command enables the user to test their setup, and modify and tear down Python scripts in a lab environment without the need to be connected to a VSD. The successful execution of the command for action setup will create a VSD domain and the corresponding configuration, just as the system would do when the parameters are received from VSD.
CLIs: evaluate-script domain-name [ domain-name ] type [ type ] action <script-action> [ vni <vni-id> ] [ rt-i <ext-community> ] [ rt-e <ext-community> ] [ metadata <metadata> ] policy <python-policy>

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the VSD domain name. 64 characters maximum.
Specifies the VSD domain type. Values-l2-domain, vrf-gre, vrf-vxlan, l2-domain-irb.
Specifies the action taken for Python scripts. Values-setup, modify, teardown.
Specifies the VNI ID. Values-1 to 16777215.
Specifies the opaque key=value pairs. 500 characters maximum.
Specifies the name of the Python script used to translate the VSD parameters into a configuration. 32 characters maximum.
